Language.Text: Destroy Centauri Settlement

%TargetName% is a nest of Centauri warlords. No station in the system will be safe until you destroy it.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: None

The station master looks at you sternly:
"There's a settlement at the edge of the system. It's a safe haven for warlords. We won't be safe until the settlement is destroyed!"

The station master tenses up. She stares right at you, her eyes filling up.
"We don't have a choice! The warlords won't stop! They take what they want, killing anyone who gets in their way.
"This won't end until they're all dead!"
Language.String: "[W]hat about the innocent people of the settlement?"
Language.Text:
"No one on the settlement is innocent! If they're supporting the warlords then they're just as guilty. You can't compromise with people who are trying to kill you!
"Will you help us?"

The station master sighs and slumps down on her console.
"I don't like it any more than you do, but there's nothing we can do. You have to destroy the settlement!"

The station master wipes away her tears.
"You're a coward! When the warlords return and kill us all, the blood will be on your hands."
"What's wrong? You said you could handle this mission! Get back out there and finish the job!"

The citizens of Raisu Station are celebrating in the halls. The air is filled with music and laughter.
The station master approaches you, a bottle of Exile Starport in her hand:
"Come on, pilgrim, this party is for you! We never would have killed the tyrants if it wasn't for you!"
Mission complete!

The station master smiles as you enter:
"We'll always remember how you freed us from the warlords."
The station master is working at her console. She sees you but does not want to talk.

The station master is working at her console. The comms channels are quiet and she stops to chat.
"You were right about sparing the Centauri settlement. I was too angry to see it then, but more killing would not have helped anyone."
Destroyed Centauri settlement in Eridani
Spared Centauri settlement in Eridani

The docking bay is filled with people maintaining the station. They stop what they're doing as you enter.
A woman in a pressure suit walks up to you:
"What are you doing here, pilgrim?"

The woman laughs.
"You've killed all the leaders! The ones that remain are just criminals."

"I don't know. We don't want more fighting, but no one likes a vacuum. There will be a struggle for power, and whoever wins will decide.
"But at least we have a chance, thanks to you."

The woman shrugs.
"You think too much of me, pilgrim. One person cannot change the future.
"Not even you."
Even as she says this, you see armed men hiding in the shadows.
